definition: to satisfy rival demands (idiom)/to get the best of both worlds/to have it both ways/to have one's cake and eat it too
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
all/whole/entire/every/complete
surname Quan
his/her/its/their/that/such/it (refers to sth preceding it)
the Americas/abbr. for 美洲[Mei3 zhou1]/USA/abbr. for 美國|美国[Mei3 guo2]
beautiful/very satisfactory/good/to beautify/to be pleased with oneself

sentences.english: For Merkel and the German political establishment, it's the best of both worlds.
sentences.chinese: 对于默克尔和德国的政治体制，这是两全其美的。

sentences.english: So, RIM could have the best of both worlds.
sentences.chinese: 所以，RIM公司的做法是两全其美。

sentences.english: This gift will make you both happy.
sentences.chinese: 这份礼物就能够两全其美。

definition: to satisfy both sides/to accommodate both (demands)
one move, two gains (idiom); two birds with one stone
to kill two birds with one stone (idiom)
lit. one arrow, two golden eagles (idiom)/to kill two birds with one stone

lit. the fish and the bear's paw, you can't have both at the same time (idiom, from Mencius); fig. you must choose one or the other/you can't always get everything you want/you can't have your cake and eat it
What can you have against it? (idiom)/We should do this./Go for it!
a fine thing/a wonderful thing
As You Like It, comedy by Shakespeare
to everyone's delight and satisfaction
couldn't be better/ideal/wonderful
to get sth done once and for all

lit. the fish and the bear's paw, you can't have both at the same time (idiom, from Mencius); fig. you must choose one or the other/you can't always get everything you want/you can't have your cake and eat it
pinyin: yu2 yu3 xiong2 zhang3 bu4 ke3 jian1 de2

definition: to compromise/to take the middle road/a trade-off/eclectic
way/method/Taiwan pr. [fa2 zi5]
excellent plan/brilliant scheme
good plan/good idea
sensible act
